#summary This Wiki is the JAVA CLASSPATH variable description

= JAVA CLASSPATH variable = 

Classpath is a parameter, set either on the command-line, or through an environment variable, that tells the Java Virtual Machine or the compiler where to look for user-defined classes and packages.

To compile and execute our source code you should download the [http://jbiowh.googlecode.com/files/JBioWH-Subversion-Libraries.zip JBioWH required libraries] from our project web site.

== Windows ==

You could copy the _*lib*_ and the _*jbiowh*_ folder on the _*C:*_ directory. Then, you CLASSPATH variable will be:

{{{
C:\lib\AbsoluteLayout.jar;C:\lib\javax.persistence-2.0.3.jar;C:\lib\eclipselink-2.3.2.jar;C:\lib\mysql-connector-java-5.1.18-bin.jar;C:\jbiowh\dist\jbiowh.jar
}}} 

== Linux ==

You could copy the _*lib*_ and the _*jbiowh*_ folder on your home directory. Then, you CLASSPATH variable will be:

{{{
/home/user/libs/AbsoluteLayout.jar:/home/user/libs/mysql-connector-java-5.1.18-bin.jar:/home/user/libs/eclipselink-2.3.2.jar:/home/user/libs/javax.persistence-2.0.3.jar:/home/user/jbiowh/dist/jbiowh.jar
}}}
